content:
ConsoleLogger Class

Definition

Implements the standard console logger that outputs event data to the console window during a build.

In this Article

public class ConsoleLogger : Microsoft.Build.Framework.INodeLogger
Inheritance
System.Object
ConsoleLogger

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

ConsoleLogger()

Initializes a new instance of the ConsoleLogger class.

public ConsoleLogger ();

ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity)

Initializes a new instance of the ConsoleLogger class with the specified LoggerVerbosity.

public ConsoleLogger (Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity verbosity);
verbosity
LoggerVerbosity

The LoggerVerbosity to apply to the logger.

ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity,WriteHandler,ColorSetter,ColorResetter)

Initializes a new instance of the ConsoleLogger class with the specified LoggerVerbosity, ColorSetter, and ColorResetter values.

public ConsoleLogger (Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity verbosity, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.WriteHandler write, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ColorSetter colorSet, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ColorResetter colorReset);
verbosity
LoggerVerbosity

The LoggerVerbosity to apply to the logger.

write
WriteHandler

The WriteHandler for the logger to use.

colorSet
ColorSetter

The ColorSetter for the logger to use.

colorReset
ColorResetter

The ColorResetter for the logger to use.

Properties

Parameters

Gets or sets the parameters passed to the ConsoleLogger.

public string Parameters { get; set; }
Value
String

The parameters passed to the ConsoleLogger.

ShowSummary

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the logger will display a summary of errors and warnings.

public bool ShowSummary { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the logger will display a summary of errors and warnings; otherwise, false.

SkipProjectStartedText

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the logger will display messages when new projects are started during the build.

public bool SkipProjectStartedText { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to display messages when new projects are started during the build; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Verbosity

Gets or sets the LoggerVerbosity level of the logger.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Verbosity { get; set; }
Value
LoggerVerbosity

The LoggerVerbosity level of the logger.

WriteHandler

Gets or sets to the WriteHandler delegate for the ConsoleLogger.

protected Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.WriteHandler WriteHandler { get; set; }
Value
WriteHandler

The WriteHandler delegate for the ConsoleLogger.

Methods

ApplyParameter(String,String)

Adds the specified parameter name and value to the logger.

public void ApplyParameter (string parameterName, string parameterValue);
parameterName
String

The parameter name to add to the logger.

parameterValue
String

The parameter value to assign to the parameterName.

BuildFinishedHandler(Object,BuildFinishedEventArgs)

Handles the BuildFinished event.

public void BuildFinishedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildFinishedEventArgs e);

System.Object

The source of the event.

e
BuildFinishedEventArgs

A BuildFinishedEventArgs that contains the event data.

public void BuildStartedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildStartedEventArgs e);
sender

The source of the event.

A BuildStartedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Handles the CustomEventRaised event.

e

A CustomBuildEventArgs that contains the event data.

System.Object

The source of the event.

e
BuildErrorEventArgs

Initialize(IEventSource)

Registers the logger for the specified events.

public virtual void Initialize (Microsoft.Build.Framework.IEventSource eventSource);
eventSource
IEventSource

The IEventSource to register with the logger.

Initialize(IEventSource,Int32)

Registers the logger for the specified events.

public virtual void Initialize (Microsoft.Build.Framework.IEventSource eventSource, int nodeCount);
eventSource
IEventSource

The IEventSource to register with the logger.

nodeCount
Int32

The number of nodes to initialize.

The source of the event.

e
ProjectStartedEventArgs

A ProjectStartedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Shutdown()

Stops the logger and releases all resources.

public virtual void Shutdown ();

Remarks

The default console logger does not need to release any resources. This method does nothing.
